messages.subject: Re: needs vs wants
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Rebecca - I m in S. Orange.  What part of SD are you in? By the way - hi all!  I m new-ish and have been reading and learning.  :)  Thanks for having me.
messages.messageBody:
Hi Rebecca - I'm in S. Orange. What part of SD are you in?

By the way - hi all! I'm new-ish and have been reading and
learning. :) Thanks for having me.

~Alyce

--- In Unschooling-dotcom@y..., "rebecca" <elfmama92104@y...> wrote:
> Normally my dh would be home, he was injured on the job a year ago
> and is not able to go back to work, but he has been helping a
friend
> out of a tight spot the past few days so has been unable to be
home.
> Usually he would take Avery out so that Jaiden and I could spend
some
> time together or he'll take Jaiden and they'll do something just
the
> two of them. The only kids around us, that we know, are the kids in
> our apt. complex and they are very mean to Jaiden, so I'm not
> comfortable letting him spend much time with them. Also the only
> homeschoolers in my area, again that I know, are the school at home
> type and they tend to schedual their days, on top of that today, is
> the Park day that everyone goes to, I would be going but dh has the
> car and it's to far of a bus ride (@2 hours yuck!) Hopefully things
> will return to normal, what ever that is :-), soon. Just
wondering,
> anyone in the San Diego area?
> rebecca

messages.subject: Re: needs vs wants
messages.msgSnippet: Normally my dh would be home, he was injured on the job a year ago and is not able to go back to work, but he has been helping a friend out of a tight spot the
messages.messageBody:
Normally my dh would be home, he was injured on the job a year ago
and is not able to go back to work, but he has been helping a friend
out of a tight spot the past few days so has been unable to be home.
Usually he would take Avery out so that Jaiden and I could spend some
time together or he'll take Jaiden and they'll do something just the
two of them. The only kids around us, that we know, are the kids in
our apt. complex and they are very mean to Jaiden, so I'm not
comfortable letting him spend much time with them. Also the only
homeschoolers in my area, again that I know, are the school at home
type and they tend to schedual their days, on top of that today, is
the Park day that everyone goes to, I would be going but dh has the
car and it's to far of a bus ride (@2 hours yuck!) Hopefully things
will return to normal, what ever that is :-), soon. Just wondering,
anyone in the San Diego area?
rebecca
